snippet: The Financial Stability Oversight Council is appealing a federal judge’s decision to throw out its designation of MetLife as “too big to fail,” calling the judge’s analysis “profoundly mistaken.”
abstract: Financial Stability Oversight Council files brief in appeal for right to label certain financial institutions as 'too big to fail'; Federal District Court in early 2016 rejected such a designation for MetLife.
lead_paragraph: The Financial Stability Oversight Council is appealing a federal judge’s decision to throw out its designation of MetLife as “too big to fail,” calling the judge’s analysis “profoundly mistaken.”

headline.main: After MetLife Ruling, Regulators Push Back on ‘Too Big to Fail’ Label
headline.print_headline: Regulators Push Back on ‘Too Big to Fail’ Tag

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
